item.title: Bags of rubbish & a quantity of cardboard left be the litter bin on Picardy Road Belvedere DA17 near the 401/469 bus stop, 6th July

item.title: 1 foot pothole on sidcup hill, 6th July
item.description:
This has been here for 3 -4 months minimum. The vibration from traffic hitting the hole has caused my concrete front garden to have a huge crack right across. This was NOT there before the pothole appeared. WHY , after months, has this not been fixed please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 96, Sidcup Hill, North Cray, London

item.title: Complaint Regarding New Mobile Phone Mast Installation, 6th July
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise a concern regarding the recently installed mobile phone mast at the junction of Lavender Hill and The Ridgeway, which was erected this past Saturday. The new mast has been positioned directly on the pavement, contrasting with the previous mast that was sensibly located on the grass between the bus shelter and the new houses. This change has significantly reduced the width of the pavement and will be dangerously when people are walking to the nearby schools, hospital, and bus stop. Furthermore, the mast presents a potential hazard for partially sighted pedestrians as it protrudes conspicuously and is painted green, making it less noticeable against the surroundings. The additional support boxes installed alongside the mast also obstruct the view of oncoming traffic at the Lavender Hill/The Ridgeway roundabout, raising serious safety concerns for both pedestrians and drivers.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, The Ridgeway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stolen wheelie bin filled with general waste from passers by, 6th July
item.description:
A stolen wheelie bin has been positioned up the road filled with waste. This was about a week ago - but since then passers by have been using it as a litter bin to the point it is overflowing onto the street and cars. Rats and mice have been seen up and down the road and we’d like to ask you to remove the waste AND the bin. Thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 103, Chadwick Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Post Hill, Dulwich Village, London

item.title: Neighbour burning toxic materials, 6th July
item.description:
A neighbour, four flats down from me (I am at 156B graham road) has created a big fire in her garden and is burning rubbish in her garden which is creating toxic fumes. There is black smoke billowing from the fire - it is not safe!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Graham Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
